intro: Dobrowskya aspera, commonly known as the rough dobrowskya, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, giving it the species name "aspera," meaning rough in Latin. Dobrowskya aspera is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
